as a way to figure out how much of the code that we've been testing with code coverage is not necessarily the same as
path coverage like the lines might have been marked as green but we haven't tested these two green bits at the same
time we might have tested one of them in one test and one of them in another test and we don't necessarily know that we have tested everything this is why code
coverage is not necessarily a good measure for how well tested our code is it just tells us which code isn't tested

gonna add a guard page so it's going to allocate it just next to a guard page so if you try to read outside this piece of
heap that you've allocate it is going to crash because it's going to hit the guard page similarly if you free
something it's going to mark that as a guard page so you can't really go back
and read something that you're already freed and so it adds a lot of these things to your codes the problem with
